physics module¶

physics contains useful physics functions as well as constants.

physics.CMBspectrum(temp, eng)¶

Returns the CMB spectrum in number of photons/cm^3/eV, for a given temperature and energy of the photon.

Parameters:
  • temp (float) – Temperature of the CMB in eV.
  • eng (float) – Energy of the photon in eV.
Returns:

photSpecDensity – Returns the number of photons/cm^3/eV.
Return type:

float
physics.TCMB(rs)¶
physics.dtdz(rs, H0=2.1802207e-18, omegaM=0.3156, omegaRad=8e-05, omegaLambda=0.6844)¶
physics.getinjrate(injType, injFac)¶
physics.hubblerates(rs, H0=2.1802207e-18, omegaM=0.3156, omegaRad=8e-05, omegaLambda=0.6844)¶
physics.photoionrate(rs, eng, xH, xe, atom=None)¶

Returns the photoionization rate at a particular redshift, given some ionization history.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) – Redshift at which the photoionization rate is to be obtained.
  • eng (ndarray) – Energies at which the photoionization rate is to be obtained.
  • xH (float) – Ionization fraction n_H+/n_H.
  • xe (float) – Ionization fraction n_e/n_H = n_H+/n_H + n_He+/n_H.
  • atom (str, optional) – A string that must be one of 'H0', 'He0' or 'He1'. Determines which photoionization rate is returned. The default value is None, which returns all of the rates in a dict.
Returns:

ionrate – Returns a dictionary with keys 'H0', 'He0' and 'He1', each with an ndarray of the same length as eng.
Return type:

dict
